meanings.definition: A sea nymph or sea goddess in Greek mythology.
meanings.sent1: In the ancient stories, the nereid was believed to live in the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailors feared the wrath of the nereid if they angered the sea.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous nereid played tricks on the sailors by creating illusions of distant lands.
meanings.sent4: Her grace and beauty were compared to that of a nereid, gliding effortlessly through the waves.
meanings.sent5: The nereid's enchanting song lured sailors to their doom, unable to resist its haunting melody.

meanings.definition: Any of various marine worms of the family Nereidae, having a slender, elongated body and often brightly colored.
meanings.sent1: The nereid wriggled gracefully through the sand, its colorful body shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Marine biologists study the behavior of the nereid to understand its role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The fishermen were surprised to catch a nereid instead of the usual fish in their nets.
meanings.sent4: The nereid's movements in the water resembled a dance, captivating all who watched.
meanings.sent5: Children at the beach delighted in finding a nereid, marveling at its unique appearance.
